jasmin_cloud.provider package¶

Submodules¶

jasmin_cloud.provider.base module¶

This module defines the interface for a cloud provider.

class jasmin_cloud.provider.base.Provider¶

Bases: object

Class for a cloud provider.

authenticate(username, password)¶

Creates a new unscoped session for this provider using the given credentials.

Parameters:
  • username – The username to authenticate with.
  • password – The password to authenticate with.
Returns:

An UnscopedSession for the user.
class jasmin_cloud.provider.base.UnscopedSession¶

Bases: object

Class for an authenticated session with a cloud provider. It is unscoped in the sense that is not bound to a particular tenancy.

Implementations should be serialisable using pickle.

tenancies()¶

Get the tenancies available to the authenticated user.

Returns:An iterable of Tenancy objects.
scoped_session(tenancy)¶

Get a scoped session for the given tenancy.

Parameters:tenancy – The tenancy to get a scoped session for. Can be a tenancy id or a Tenancy object.
Returns:A ScopedSession for the tenancy.
class jasmin_cloud.provider.base.ScopedSession¶

Bases: object

Class for a tenancy-scoped session.

quotas()¶

Returns quota information for the tenancy.

Quota information for the following resources should always be present:

  • cpus: The vCPUs available to the tenancy.
  • ram: The RAM available to the tenancy.
  • external_ips: The external IPs available to the tenancy.
  • storage: The storage available to the tenancy.

Some implementations may also include:

  • machines: The number of machines in the tenancy.
  • volumes: The number of volumes in the tenancy.

The absence of these resources indicates that there is no specific limit.

Returns:An iterable of Quota objects.
images()¶

Lists the images available to the tenancy.

Returns:An iterable of Image objects.
find_image(id)¶

Finds an image by id.

Parameters:id – The id of the image to find.
Returns:An Image object.
sizes()¶

Lists the machine sizes available to the tenancy.

Returns:An iterable of Size objects.
find_size(id)¶

Finds a size by id.

Parameters:id – The id of the size to find.
Returns:A Size object.
machines()¶

Lists the machines in the tenancy.

Returns:An iterable of Machines.
find_machine(id)¶

Finds a machine by id.

Parameters:id – The id of the machine to find.
Returns:A Machine object.
create_machine(name, image, size, ssh_key)¶

Create a new machine in the tenancy.

Parameters:
  • name – The name of the machine.
  • image – The image to use. Can be an image id or a Image.
  • size – The size to use. Can be a size id or a Size.
  • ssh_key – The SSH key to inject into the machine.
Returns:

The created Machine.
resize_machine(machine, size)¶

Change the size of a machine.

Parameters:
  • machine – The machine. Can be a machine id or a Machine.
  • size – The size to use. Can be a size id or a Size.
Returns:

The updated Machine.
start_machine(machine)¶

Start the specified machine.

Parameters:machine – The machine. Can be a machine id or a Machine.
Returns:The updated Machine.
stop_machine(machine)¶

Stop the specified machine.

Parameters:machine – The machine. Can be a machine id or a Machine.
Returns:The updated Machine.
restart_machine(machine)¶

Restart the specified machine.

Parameters:machine – The machine. Can be a machine id or a Machine.
Returns:The updated Machine.
delete_machine(machine)¶

Delete the specified machine.

Parameters:machine – The machine. Can be a machine id or a Machine.
Returns:The updated Machine if it has transitioned to a deleting status, or None if it has already been deleted.
external_ips()¶

Returns the external IP addresses that are currently allocated to the tenancy.

Returns:An iterable of ExternalIps.
find_external_ip(ip)¶

Finds external IP details by IP address.

Returns:A ExternalIp object.
allocate_external_ip()¶

Allocates a new external IP address for the tenancy from a pool and returns it.

Returns:The allocated ExternalIp (should raise on failure).
attach_external_ip(ip, machine)¶

Attaches an external IP to a machine.

Parameters:
  • ip – The IP address to attach. Can be an external IP address as a string or a ExternalIp.
  • machine – The machine. Can be a machine id or a Machine.
Returns:

The updated ExternalIp object (should raise on failure).
detach_external_ip(ip)¶

Detaches the given external IP from whichever machine it is currently attached to.

Parameters:ip – The IP address to detach. Can be an external IP address as a string or a ExternalIp.
Returns:The updated ExternalIp object (should raise on failure).
volumes()¶

Lists the volumes currently available to the tenancy.

Returns:An iterable of Volumes.
find_volume(id)¶

Finds a volume by id.

Parameters:id – The id of the volume to find.
Returns:A Volume object.
create_volume(name, size)¶

Create a new volume in the tenancy.

Parameters:
  • name – The name of the volume.
  • size – The size of the volume in GB.
Returns:

A Volume object.
delete_volume(volume)¶

Delete the specified volume.

Parameters:volume – The volume to delete. Can be a volume id or a Volume.
Returns:The updated Volume if it has transitioned to a deleting status, or None if it has already been deleted.
attach_volume(volume, machine)¶

Attaches the specified volume to the specified machine.

Parameters:
  • volume – The volume to attach. Can be a volume id or a Volume.
  • machine – The machine. Can be a machine id or a Machine.
Returns:

The updated Volume.
detach_volume(volume)¶

Detaches the specified volume from the machine it is attached to.

Parameters:volume – The volume to detach. Can be a volume id or a Volume.
Returns:The updated Volume.

jasmin_cloud.provider.dto module¶

This module defines data-transfer objects used by providers.

class jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Tenancy¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Tenancy

Represents a tenancy/organisation on a cloud provider.

id¶

The id of the tenancy.

name¶

The human-readable name of the tenancy.

class jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Quota¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Quota

Represents a quota available to a tenancy.

resource¶

The resource that the quota is for.

units¶

The units of the quota. For a unit-less quota, use None.

allocated¶

The amount of the resource that has been allocated.

used¶

The amount of the resource that has been used.

class jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Image¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Image

Represents an image available to a tenancy.

Can be combined with a Size to create a new Machine.

id¶

The id of the image.

vm_type¶

The VM-type of the image. This is passed to the activator script when a machine is provisioned from the template, potentially allowing multiple types of machine to be provisioned from the same soft-linked image.

name¶

The human-readable name of the image.

is_public¶

Indicates if the image is public or private.

nat_allowed¶

Indicates if NAT is allowed for machines deployed from the image.

size¶

The size of the image (in MB). Can be a float for more precision.

class jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Size¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Size

Represents a machine size available to a tenancy.

A size is a specification of the number of virtaul CPUs and RAM available to a machine.

Can be combined with an Image to create a new Machine.

id¶

The id of the size.

name¶

The human-readable name of the size.

cpus¶

The number of CPUs.

ram¶

The amount of RAM (in MB).

disk¶

The size of the image’s disk (in GB). Can be -1 to indicate no root disk size limit.

class jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Machine¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Machine

Represents a machine in a tenancy.

id¶

The id of the machine.

name¶

The human-readable name of the machine.

image_id¶

The id of the image used to deploy the machine.

size_id¶

The of the size of the machine.

status¶

The Status of the machine.

power_state¶

The power state of the machine as a string.

task¶

String representation of any task that is currently executing.

internal_ip¶

The internal IPv4 address of the machine.

external_ip¶

The external IPv4 address of the machine.

nat_allowed¶

Indicates if NAT is allowed for the machine.

attached_volume_ids¶

A tuple of ids of attached volumes for the machine.

owner¶

The username of the user who deployed the machine.

created¶

The datetime at which the machine was deployed.

class Status¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Status

Represents a machine status.

type¶

The Type of the status.

name¶

A short string representation of the status.

details¶

A string representing any details of the status, e.g. an error.

class Type¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Enum representing the possible status types.

BUILD = 'BUILD'¶
ACTIVE = 'ACTIVE'¶
ERROR = 'ERROR'¶
OTHER = 'OTHER'¶
class jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Volume¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.Volume

Represents a volume attached to a machine.

id¶

The id of the volume.

name¶

The name of the volume.

status¶

The Status of the volume.

size¶

The size of the volume in GB.

machine_id¶

The id of the machine the volume is attached to, or None if the volume is not attached.

device¶

The device that the volume is attached on, or None if the volume is not attached.

class Status¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Enum representing the possible volume statuses.

CREATING = 'CREATING'¶
AVAILABLE = 'AVAILABLE'¶
ATTACHING = 'ATTACHING'¶
DETACHING = 'DETACHING'¶
IN_USE = 'IN_USE'¶
DELETING = 'DELETING'¶
ERROR = 'ERROR'¶
OTHER = 'OTHER'¶
class jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.ExternalIp¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.dto.ExternalIp

Represents an externally visible IP address.

external_ip¶

The externally visible IP address.

machine_id¶

The ID of the machine to which the external IP address is mapped, or None if it is not mapped.

jasmin_cloud.provider.errors module¶

This module defines the exceptions that can be thrown by a cloud provider.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error¶

Bases: Exception

Base class for all other errors in this module.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.BadInputError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error, RuntimeError

Raised when the input to a create or update is invalid. Invalid input to a find should raise ObjectNotFoundError.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.UnsupportedOperationError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error, NotImplementedError

Raised when the requested operation is not supported by a provider.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.InvalidOperationError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error, RuntimeError

Raised when an operation is invalid for the current state of the target.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.QuotaExceededError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.InvalidOperationError

Raised when a quota is exceeded.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.ImproperlyConfiguredError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error, RuntimeError

Raised when a tenancy is not configured as expected/required.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.ObjectNotFoundError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error, RuntimeError

Raised when an object requested by ID is not found.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.AuthenticationError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error, RuntimeError

Raised when authentication fails when accessing a resource.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.PermissionDeniedError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error, RuntimeError

Raised when permission is denied while accessing a resource.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.CommunicationError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error, RuntimeError

Raised when an unexpected communication problem occurs.

exception jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.OperationTimedOutError¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.errors.Error, RuntimeError

Raised when an operation takes too long to wait for.

jasmin_cloud.provider.openstack module¶

This module contains the provider implementation for OpenStack.

class jasmin_cloud.provider.openstack.Provider(auth_url, domain='Default', verify_ssl=True)¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.base.Provider

Provider implementation for OpenStack.

Parameters:
  • auth_url – The Keystone v3 authentication URL.
  • domain – The domain to authenticate with.
  • verify_ssl – If True (the default), verify SSL certificates. If False SSL certificates are not verified.
provider_name = 'openstack'¶
authenticate(username, password)¶

See base.Provider.authenticate().

jasmin_cloud.provider.openstack.convert_sdk_exceptions(f)¶

Decorator that converts OpenStack SDK exceptions into errors from errors.

class jasmin_cloud.provider.openstack.UnscopedSession(auth_url, username, token, verify_ssl=True)¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.base.UnscopedSession

Unscoped session implementation for OpenStack.

Parameters:
  • auth_url – The Keystone v2.0 authentication URL.
  • username – The username of the OpenStack user.
  • token – An unscoped user token for the OpenStack user.
  • verify_ssl – If True (the default), verify SSL certificates. If False SSL certificates are not verified.
provider_name = 'openstack'¶
tenancies()¶

See base.UnscopedSession.tenancies().

scoped_session(tenancy)¶

See base.UnscopedSession.scoped_session().

class jasmin_cloud.provider.openstack.ScopedSession(username, tenancy_id, tenancy_name, connection)¶

Bases: jasmin_cloud.provider.base.ScopedSession

Tenancy-scoped session implementation for OpenStack.

Parameters:
  • username – The username of the OpenStack user.
  • tenancy_id – The tenancy id.
  • tenancy_name – The name of the tenancy.
  • connection – An openstack.connection.Connection for the tenancy.
